Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a layover”
Reviews.Author: YayoNorCal
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled for a late arrival at Midway Airport and needed a place for one night. I was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised by what this little Inn had to offer! From checking in, through breakfast to check-out, every employee was very friendly and courteous. I'm not talking about the kind of staged friendliness that comes from regimental "customer service training." This was genuine and natural stuff -and we really appreciated it! Our room really was a suite. Adequate bathroom, nice sitting room and a very comfortable bed in the bedroom. And no airport noise! The continental breakfast was pretty standard but had more choices and was better than most places. All in all, it was perfect for our 12 hour stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a stopover, near Midway Airport”
Reviews.Author: JaneT013
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in Chicago because of bad weather, but this is a good place to stay, right near the airport. There is a free shuttle to/from Midway every 20 minutes (also goes to other nearby hotels). The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was very pleasant. You can get room service from the TGI Fridays nearby, and the dinner was excellent. Free wireless! Continental breakfast was included. The only problem for me was that the room heater was quite noisy, and kept turning on and off all night. I would stay here again if I were passing through Midway.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, great transportation, has fitness room”
Reviews.Author: bicycledude
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was great: real oatmeal, several choices of cold cereal, boiled eggs, bagels, muffins, biscuit-egg-ham sandwiches, yogurt, juice, coffee, hot water/tea bags, waffles, apples, bananas. When I booked the room, the web site didn't mention a fitness center, but there was a small one, with a stairmaster, a treadmill, and an exercise bike. There was a computer and printer in the lobby, and free wi-fi (log in with your name each day and start a 24-hour timer.) They also offered to print a boarding pass and slip it under your door the morning of your departure. There was a pile of free USA Today newspapers at the desk each morning, and warm cookies at some point in the afternoon. The shuttle to Midway is shared among a half dozen hotels located adjacent to one another. In one direction, it picks up near one of the baggage claim stations; in the other direction, it drops you off at the checkin area for your particular airline. While it runs 24x7,they advised us to phone the hotel to trigger it. The shuttle does not go to the Orange Line Midway "el" station per se, but there's a (longish) indoor walking corridor between the Midway terminal and that station. We were able to visit a variety of Chicago attractions by public transit. The 54B bus stops on Cicero Ave near 65th St, just outside the hotel complex, and runs to the Orange Line Midway station (and beyond.) The Orange Line takes you to the Loop (shopping, Art Institute.) The 55 bus takes you (slowly) from the Orange Line Midway station to the Museum of Science and Industry, the Hyde Park area, U of Chicago, and the Frank Lloyd Wright Robie house. By transferring from 54B to 54 to the Green Line, you can even get to Oak Park where the Frank Lloyd Wright home and studio are located. I bought a CTA pass, good for one person for 72 hours from first use on buses and the "el" (but not on Metra trains, which are not CTA); I bought mine from a machine at the Amtrak station, but they're also sold at CVS and Walgreens. Employees and passengers alike were helpful when I had questions about public transit, and it was a relief not to deal with traffic, unfamiliar streets, parking, and gas. It was also cheap! The downside, of course, is that it takes longer. However, the trains and buses I mentioned above run so often and are so well coordinated that I spent very little time waiting to get on; the extra time was due mostly to frequent stops on the buses. There's a printable route guide on the CTA web site, but I found I needed to use Google maps (clicking on the "public transit" icon) to figure out which buses and trains to take and when they arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Crusha
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay here, with an early flight out of Midway Airport. The hotel is very convenient for the Midway business traveler, but not so convenient for the casual Chicago sightseeing crowd. The hotel is a short shuttle ride to MDW, but 40 minutes to downtown Chicago. The hotel itself has good sized and clean rooms. Two minor complaints: The climate control / air conditioner cycled on and off throughout the night and was pretty noisy. It did not make for a restful sleep. Also, the hotel charges for parking whether you have a car or not. Its only $10, but for me, this is the difference between an above average rating and just average. Its an unecessary annoyance for an otherwise generally pleased business traveler. Breakfast was above average and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place, near the airport with shuttle”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: Flying out of Midway is such a plus to me. This hotel is convenient to it. Plus the have a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Connections”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel and overall I was very pleased with it, the staff and the room. My pick up from the airport was very timely and the next day I returned to the airport where I connected with the orange line to go downtown. I was taking an Amtrak train and the orange line drops you off 3 blocks from Union Station. Even if you are not making connections like myself I would highly recommend the Fairfield for value, location and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice at Midway”
Reviews.Author: huskervballfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on the night of July 15, 2011. I was pleased with the cleanliness and service at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: debbie1759
Reviews.Content: For our annual Red Sox trip, we decided on this hotel due to the cost as the downtown hotels were much more expensive and the fact we weren't renting a car and we were flying in/out of Midway. The staff was great and answered any questions we had regarding directions, restaurants, etc. KUDOS to them. With the shuttle bus running every 20 minutes, we were able to jump on the Orange line (Midway airport) to head downtown and switch to the red line to get to Cellular Field. Got to know the Chicago Transportation very well during our 3-days. Granted we had to add about an hour each way but considering everything, this was the best route to go as we didn't have to worry about the traffic and then finding/paying for parking. As far as the rooms at the hotel, the rooms have seen better days. Everything worked, ie. a/c, lights, tv, etc. but they were dated. As we didn't spend time in the rooms, it was fine. As far as the posts on bed begs....no sign of them as the room was clean. Breakfast in the morning was typical for this type hotels (ie. waffle maker), although the pancake/sausage roll was different. My only comment was on the microwave they have was a commercial one that really didn't have any clear direction on the buttons to push for how long items needed to warm-up/cook. There was one staff person that did a great job manning this area. All in all, a nice hotel that fit our budget and had a decent breakfast to start our day.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the Location”
Reviews.Author: TKD1BB
Reviews.Content: Of course in Chicago, you are going to pay more to be downtown - but you will also pay more if you want to be close to Midway Airport if you are flying in and out of there. This hotel is only a couple miles from the airport, so it's certainly convenient. We came into town with no reservation and first tried the Holiday Inn next door ($200 a night) - similar for the Marriott and HIlton here - all these hotels are in a hotel 'circle' right next to each other. The Fairfield Inn was $170 a night (with AAA discount) and all the properties charge for parking ($13 a night) - they claim it's due to airport regulations. Which is why I only gave it an average - the value is inflated due to location. The room was fine, but an extremely small bathroom area - only about 6 inches on either side of the sink for your 'stuff'. There's a small pool/jacuzzi and fitness area. The breakfast is very nice - they make waffles for you, plus have egg sandwiches/omelettes you can heat up in the micro along with all the standard continental breakfast items. The staff was nice. I used my own car, so can't comment on the walk to the El, etc., but this is really not such the 'bad neighborhood' that everyone seems to comment on. Costco/Walmart/Target right down the street for any needed items. Only 9 miles from downtown/Lakeshore drive. A TGI Fridays across the parking lot - food was good, service was a little spotty, but it was popular.

Reviews.Title: “Not my hotel of choice”
Reviews.Author: EricL97332
Reviews.Content: Came in for a convention and was one of the best options I could find. The room was clean but there were stains on the chair, floor which kind of creeped me out. Location does not seem to be in a good area. We felt safe but didn't want to leave the compound of hotels to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: ckotadia
Reviews.Content: location was a little far, but the place is exrtremely nice and quite, very difficult to find a cab from the place although, the breakfast felt like eating at home, cozy place, but the hotel has no restaurant (neighbouring one has although)

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs at Inn of Chicao”
Reviews.Author: toadstoolharry
Reviews.Content: I woke up the first morning after staying at the Inn, COVERED in bed bug bites. I had never gotten them before and did not know what they were, but over a week later, being still very red, itchy and boethersome, it was confirmed by a dermatologist. I called the Inn twice to inform them, and was hung up on both times. Calls left with management have also gone unanswered. After looking on the internet it seems many people have contacted the Inn to complain or inform them of their problem, yet the staff their denied hearing anything about it when I spoke with them. The friends I stayed with in the room also have bites. I've washed all my clothing and bedding here at home to make sure I havent taken the bugs with me back home. Will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: irislillyUsa
Reviews.Content: Yes, with all the traveling that I do, I have never experienced bed bugs until the stay at Fairfield at Midway airport in Chicago. I got 13 bites, saw 2 bugs the next day and management denied that there was any bugs! They said they inspected the bed and nothing was there. They would not help other than change our room. DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had everything except the flat screen”
Reviews.Author: bonzi530
Reviews.Content: treadmill, pool i would have gone in if three kids had not already been in it when i arrived. nice bed, good room, felt safe, TGIF was 300 feet away as was the marriott where i had my meeting. staff was nice, vending machines and great breakfast. for 125 (they didn't charge for parking) it was a steal compared to the others that went for 150+

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lorgre
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the negatives in others' reviews. We found our room to be just right. We did not spend much time in it as we caught the shuttle to Midway and from there got on the mass transit train to go downtown. This is not hard to do, although one has to walk through the airport to the opposite side (East?) to get on the trains. We did this trip to Chicago without a vehicle, purchasing our passes from a kiosk at the airport. They are then good to ride any bus or train. My favorite part of the hotel was the bed! It was THE most comfortable bed I have ever slept on - anywhere! The linens are all completely washable, and you get the impression that they have just been laundered before you use them. We had a microwave and a refrigerator and that met our needs quite well. For our family of four the suite was a little small when we had the rollaway out and the sofa bed opened, but again, this was only when it was time to sleep. We found the staff to be quite helpful and enthusiastic, and the cookies in the evenings were wonderful; just get there early!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but basic”
Reviews.Author: scrubguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very typical, fairly new Fairfield Inn & Suites. I was granted an upgrade to a suite, which was the typical Fairfield suite layout. The only real difference was NO FLATSCREENS. I guess you could say I am spoiled to the Marriott flatscreens. The pool is inside, and usually full of kids. However, the kids were not a bother here as I never noticed them, except in the pool. The hotel is located in the Midway Airport Hotel Center which has about six or seven hotels of different qualities in a very small space. There is a shuttle which will take you to the airport and presumably other nearby locations such as the "L" stations. The staff is friendly if not "just there". There is no market at this location so expect to walk across the parking lot to the Courtyard or TGIFriday's if you need a late night snack or drink. The business center consists of ONE computer so don't expect to use it very often. There is no view to speak of from any of the rooms, unless you like watching planes land. Speaking of planes, although the hotel is within shouting distance of MDW, I never heard an airplane from my room. Traffic on Cicero is horrible at times so don't expect to get anywhere fast. However, Giordano's is about 2 blocks away which is a nice little treat for this part of town. Also, a White Castle is 2 or 3 blocks away. The bad news...my room had several spots of damage. The wall next to the computer chair had many tears in the wall paper, I guess from the chair bumping against the wall. The soap dish in the shower had mold all around the caulking. And, worst of all, my toilet stopped working on day two....but to the staffs credit, was fixed by the time I got home from work the next day. All in all, a nice hotel for the price, about $130 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELERSFROMSEATTLE
Reviews.Content: We chose the Fairfield for convenience to Midway Airport (10 minute drive) and an early a.m. flight. The Fairfield is located in a center of hotels (Marriott, Courtyard, Hilton Garden, Sleep Inn, and Hampton Inn) which share courtesy shuttles and a parking lot. The FF was similar in price to the other hotels. They provided an outstanding complimentary (extended) breakfast. Good variety with all the basics. Freshly made waffles were a treat! The courtesy shuttle runs 24/7 to Midway. It was prompt and very convenient. The immediate vicinity of the hotel is sketchy so we used Midway Airport as access for the â€œElâ€�. From Midway you can easily and cheaply get to downtown Chicago via public transportation and without having to pay city parking fees. In our double bed room, we experienced clean and quiet accommodations. You may hear a rumble from an airplane, but you're virtually at the airport! It's really not bad at all. I happen to think my bed was extremely comfortable, better than other more expensive hotels we stayed in - best sleep on our trip. We didnâ€™t go into the pool, but we saw it was very small â€“ good for kids. Whirlpool was out of commission? The FF also provides guests with complimentary access to a PC w/Internet and printer for business purposes. We were pleased with our stay at the Midway Fairfield.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: 5166narda
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice, good breakfast for a delux contential. They make you pay $10 per day just to park your car. With $160 room rate, it ended up at $200 per day with parking and tax. Just too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a group”
Reviews.Author: kansasfan
Reviews.Content: Took a group of 32 -- 20 high school senior physics students and 12 parents -- to Fairfield April 4-6. Wonderful experience for our group just spending 2 nights. Great variety for breakfast. Not a complaint. Minimal waits for trolley to Midway where we caught Orange Line to downtown. Very helpful by providing a room where we kept our luggage after 2nd night and picked up to take evening flight. Price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eat-A-Lot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value considering the price of hotels in the Chicago area. It was clean & in good condition. The staff was QUITE friendly & more than eager to assist. The indoor pool was a bit small, but served it's purpose for our young children. We did not notice any excessive noise even tho the hotel is close to Midway airport. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to/from Midway which was very nice (& very prompt). We took the Metra train into Chicago, then took an El train to Midway & called the hotel to ask for the shuttle pick up. We anticipated a lengthy wait for the shuttle, but it was there within 5 minutes! The drive to the hotel was less than 10 minutes. There is a Fridays restuarant across the parking lot from the hotel that I would recommend for a decent meal, especially if you do not have a car. The free hotel breakfast was quite ample with a nice variety of choices. The staff kept the food well stocked at all times. I would recommend this hotel as an option to staying downtown if you are on a budget. We went to an event at the University of Chicago and took a cab from the hotel to the campus. Even after having lived in Chicago for 10 years, I was surprised at the $35 cab fare for this ride! Considering the nature of the neighborhood we drove through, however, I would not recommend public transportation as an option. We also took a cab to the Museum of Science & Industry from the hotel & the price was not as steep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shuttle could be more frequent”
Reviews.Author: nicolasj
Reviews.Content: I unexpectedly had to stay a day longer then planned in Chicago, so I decided to get a room close to the airport. The hotel is in fact located in a compound with a total of 7 hotels (and 3 more are planned I heard). The place has no charm at all, like most hotels in the US, but it's all quite functional. NEGATIVE POINTS - Given the number of hotels, and the proximity of the airport, the frequency of the aiport shuttle van could be higher (I twice had to wait just over 10 minutes). - When I arrived, 2 girls at reception where discussing an invitation to a party or a wedding they just received, which made them clearly less concentrated on the arriving new guests. A more profesional attitude would be better. - some airplane noise enters the rooms POSITIVE POINTS - Nice pool - Generally comfortable and clean hotel - Excellent location relative to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, very clean, one of the best FFIs”
Reviews.Author: cruisermeg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 3 occasions in the last several weeks. The staff here are all excellent. Check in is always speedy, as is airport pick up. There are 6 or 7 hotels on this property: The FFI, A Courtyard and a Full-Service Marriott, a Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton, Slle Inn and A Holiday Inn Express. They all share a shuttle to and from the airport. There is also a TGIFridays in the Courtyard. The nice thing is that Fridays will do room service, take out AND you can charge to your room if you are a guest in any of the hotels. They have a good happy hour too! The Marriott also has a full service restaurant but I have not tried it. Prices seem average for a Marriott restaurant. As for the FFI, the rooms are decent sizes. All are nonsmoking and have the new Marriott beds. LOTS of TV channels if this is important, free internet,etc The free breakfast in the AM features cereals, Jimmy Dean egg sandwiches, waffles, breads and danish. Honestly, my only complaint is that they need to get some better pastries...maybe muffins or donuts or something. They do offer a park-n-fly and you can get some decent rates if you are a Marriott rewards member. Rates aren't bad anyway. AIrport noise isn't bad and the hotel is less noisy than many in which I have stayed. Rooms are clean, staff is attentive and welcoming and you can take the shuttle to the airport and hop on the Orange line to downtown (about 45 minutes to Chicago give or take). There are a few other places around to eat that are walkable...Giordano's, McDs, BK, White Castle and a few others. Many flight crews stay in these hotels and they were talking about some local bars nearby. The PACE bus stops right at the edge of the property and it is a short ride to a mall, Target, Wal-Mart and a couple other places. Overall, a decent place to sllep for an early flight or to visit Chicago if you want to save some money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Park & Fly”
Reviews.Author: Sandinmypants
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times now using the "Park & Fly" option. It's great because it's close to Midway, and it's easy to get to (we come from Iowa to Chicago to fly out because it's less expensive). We've tried flying out of O'Hare, but getting to & from the airport and the hotel options, then using the interstates in that area, we always end up getting on the wrong road or something, and all the tollways up that way are just a mess. Midway is much easier to access. Anyway, this hotel is great for the Park & Fly option. It's very clean, and now that it has been remodeled the rooms are updated nicely. Good beds, and the pool area is nice also. The breakfast opens very early (5am, I believe) for those that need to fly out early. The trolley system to & from Midway is very convenient and easy to use. We've never had to wait long, and the drivers are very courteous. The front desk staff at this hotel are good, check-in is quick and painless with no confusion. We will continue to use this hotel every time we fly out of Midway, which is generally twice a year for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: sk8jdgca
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights here over canadian civic holiday (1st weekend in aug) the renovations were complete and we actually got invited to an opening reception ( the kids got little pillow squishees) Room was clean and average in size. The pool is salt water which is a bit weird. We had trouboe with the hot tub. one day it wasn;t hot enough, the next day it was so hot that it turned our skin bright red. towels seemed to be in short supply at the pool too. -check before you get in. There was a trolley that takes you to the airport where you can catch the L train downtown- we did this for 3 days and enjoyed the trip. The tolley drivers were very nice. The mexican place across the road was inexpensive and quite good. As was the hotdog stand acorss the road
